name: World_Development_Indicators.per_si_allsi
description: World Bank Development Indicators: per_si_allsi.adq_pop_tot, per_si_allsi.ben_q1_tot, per_si_allsi.cov_pop_tot, per_si_allsi.cov_q2_tot, per_si_allsi.cov_q3_tot, per_si_allsi.cov_q4_tot, per_si_allsi.cov_q1_tot, per_si_allsi.cov_q5_tot

outputs.name: per_si_allsi.adq_pop_tot
outputs.display_name: Adequacy of social insurance programs (% of total welfare of beneficiary households)
outputs.description: Adequacy of social insurance programs is measured by the total transfer amount received by the population participating in social insurance programs as a share of their total welfare. Welfare is defined as the total income or total expenditure of beneficiary households. Social insurance programs include old age contributory pensions (including survivors and disability) and social security and health insurance benefits (including occupational injury benefits, paid sick leave, maternity and other social insurance). Estimates include both direct and indirect beneficiaries.
outputs.unit: % of total welfare of beneficiary households
outputs.unit_description: % of total welfare of beneficiary households

outputs.name: per_si_allsi.ben_q1_tot
outputs.display_name: Benefit incidence of social insurance programs to poorest quintile (% of total social insurance benefits)
outputs.description: Benefit incidence of social insurance programs to poorest quintile shows the percentage of total social insurance benefits received by the poorest 20% of the population. Social insurance programs include old age contributory pensions (including survivors and disability) and social security and health insurance benefits (including occupational injury benefits, paid sick leave, maternity and other social insurance). Estimates include both direct and indirect beneficiaries.

outputs.name: per_si_allsi.cov_pop_tot
outputs.display_name: Coverage of social insurance programs (% of population)
outputs.description: Coverage of social insurance programs shows the percentage of population participating in programs that provide old age contributory pensions (including survivors and disability) and social security and health insurance benefits (including occupational injury benefits, paid sick leave, maternity and other social insurance). Estimates include both direct and indirect beneficiaries.
